intro.title: What is RandomGame.zip?
intro.p1: RandomGame.zip is a free web game service that helps friends, couples, family, and coworkers fairly decide order, penalties, or who pays.
intro.p2: The name "RandomGame.zip" means "let‚Äôs make a bet" in Korean.
intro.p3: No installation or signup is required. You can use it instantly in any browser on mobile, tablet, or desktop.
intro.p4: Roulette, dice, ladder game, and bomb pick are gathered in one place to solve the simple question ‚Äî "Who should do it?" ‚Äî in the easiest and most fun way.

birth.title: How It Started
birth.p1: RandomGame.zip was born from everyday moments at work ‚Äî deciding who buys coffee, desserts, or takes turns paying for lunch.
birth.p2: Rock-paper-scissors kept ending in ties, took too long, and sometimes didn‚Äôt feel fair.
birth.p3: We needed a fast and transparent way to decide, so instead of searching different tools every time, we created one place with all decision games.

features.title: Features
items: No login required
Works on mobile and desktop
Fair random algorithm
Simple and fast interface
Easy to view together on one screen
Completely free
features.closing: Not just a game ‚Äî a tool that helps make everyday decisions.

sections.outro: RandomGame.zip isn‚Äôt just a game site ‚Äî it‚Äôs a fun way to make small daily decisions quickly.

sections.title: Information We Collect
sections.content: RandomGame.zip does not require sign-up or login and does not directly collect personally identifiable information. Participant names entered in games are processed only within your browser and are not stored on our servers. However, we may collect anonymized usage statistics (page visits, browser type, device type, etc.) for service improvement and analytics.

sections.title: Cookies and Tracking
sections.content: RandomGame.zip may use cookies for service operation and advertising. Third-party advertising services such as Google AdSense may use their own cookies to provide personalized ads. You can disable cookies in your browser settings, but some features may be limited.

sections.title: Third-Party Services
sections.content: RandomGame.zip may use third-party services such as Google AdSense (advertising) and Google Analytics (traffic analysis). These services collect and process data according to their own privacy policies. Please refer to the respective service's privacy policy for details.

sections.title: Data Storage
sections.content: RandomGame.zip does not store your game data on servers. All game processing occurs within your browser, and data is automatically deleted when you close the page. Some user preferences such as language settings may be stored in your browser's local storage.

sections.title: Children's Privacy
sections.content: RandomGame.zip is not intended for children under 13 and does not intentionally collect personal information from children. If we become aware that a child under 13 has provided personal information, we will promptly delete such information.

sections.title: Policy Changes
sections.content: This privacy policy may be updated due to legal changes or service updates. Significant changes will be announced on this page. Continued use of the service after policy changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

sections.title: Contact
sections.content: If you have questions about this privacy policy, please contact us at dev.yelee@gmail.com.

sections.title: Acceptance of Terms
sections.content: By using the RandomGame.zip website (the 'Service'), you agree to these Terms of Service. If you do not agree, please discontinue use of the Service.

sections.title: Service Description
sections.content: RandomGame.zip is a web service providing various free random games including roulette, dice, ladder game, and bomb draw. The Service is provided for entertainment and decision-making assistance purposes and has no connection to actual gambling or monetary rewards.

sections.title: User Responsibilities
sections.content: Users must use the Service only for lawful purposes. Activities that harm others, such as defamation, discrimination, or harassment through the Service, are prohibited. Actions that disrupt normal service operation (hacking, DDoS attacks, etc.) are prohibited.

sections.title: Intellectual Property
sections.content: All intellectual property rights in RandomGame.zip's design, code, and content belong to the service operator. Unauthorized reproduction, distribution, or modification of service content is prohibited.

sections.title: Disclaimer
sections.content: RandomGame.zip is provided 'as is' without warranties of fitness for a particular purpose or error-free operation. Game results are randomly generated, and the Service assumes no legal liability for the fairness of results. The Service may be changed or discontinued without prior notice.

sections.title: Limitation of Liability
sections.content: The service operator shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from the use of RandomGame.zip, to the extent permitted by law.

sections.title: Changes to Terms
sections.content: These Terms of Service may be changed as needed. Updated terms take effect upon posting on this page. Continued use of the Service after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated terms.

sections.title: Contact
sections.content: If you have questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us at dev.yelee@gmail.com.

intro.title: What is Roulette?
intro.p1: Roulette is the most intuitive and fun way to fairly select one person from a group. Enter participant names and they'll be evenly placed on a spinning wheel ‚Äî the name where the arrow stops is selected.
intro.p2: RandomGame.zip's roulette uses a completely random algorithm to guarantee equal selection probability for all participants. No app installation required ‚Äî use it directly in your browser with 2 to 12 participants.

rules.title: Detailed Rules
items: Enter participant names separated by commas or line breaks.
You can enter between 2 and 12 participants.
Press Start to go to the roulette wheel screen.
Press Spin and the wheel rotates at a random speed.
When the wheel stops, the participant the arrow points to is selected.

tips.title: When to Use
items: Deciding who pays for lunch or coffee
Choosing a presenter or meeting facilitator
Fairly selecting someone for a penalty
Picking one option from multiple choices like menus or places

items.a: Yes, RandomGame.zip's roulette uses a cryptographically secure random number generator to ensure completely random results. Equal probability is applied to all participants.

items.q: Can I play again with the same participants?
items.a: Yes, on the result screen, press the 'Same players' button to spin again with the same participants without re-entering names.
Yes, RandomGame.zip is built with responsive design and works identically on smartphones, tablets, and PCs.

steps: Press Spin to spin the roulette
üéØ The person it lands on is selected

intro.title: What is Breakout?
intro.p1: Breakout is a random winner game using the classic arcade game. Enter participant names and one block per person is created, each labeled with a participant's name.
intro.p2: The ball breaks blocks as it bounces around, and the name on the last surviving block becomes the winner. The suspense of not knowing whose block will survive makes it exciting.

rules.title: Detailed Rules
items: Enter participant names (2 to 40 people).
One block per participant is automatically created.
Each participant's name appears on an equal number of blocks.
Press Play and the ball bounces off walls, breaking blocks automatically.
The name on the last remaining block is the winner.

tips.title: When to Use
items: When you want to pick a winner in a fun way
When you want visual effects with your bet
When you want retro arcade vibes for decisions
When you want to liven up a party or gathering

items.a: Press Play and the ball moves automatically, bouncing off walls and blocks. Just sit back and watch!

items.q: How is the number of blocks determined?
items.a: One block is created per participant. For example, 5 people get 5 blocks, 30 people get 30 blocks.
Block positions are randomly shuffled and the ball physics engine determines the outcome, producing unpredictable and fair results.

steps: Press Play to start the game
üß± The last block standing is the winner

intro.title: What is the Slot Machine?
intro.p1: The Slot Machine is a random selection game where a reel spins with participant names. Names scroll rapidly and gradually slow down until the reel stops on the winner.
intro.p2: The reel gradually slows and stops, building suspense until the final name is revealed. Supports 2 to 100 participants.

rules.title: Detailed Rules
items: Enter participant names (2 to 100 people).
Press Start to go to the slot machine screen.
Press Spin and the reel starts spinning.
Names scroll rapidly then gradually slow down until the reel stops.
Once the reel stops, the winner is announced.

tips.title: When to Use
items: When you want a casino-style fun way to pick someone
When you want to liven up a party or gathering
When you want a suspenseful way to select a penalty target
When you want visual excitement with your bet

items.a: Yes, the winner is selected completely at random before the spin begins. Equal probability is applied to all participants.

items.q: Can I play again with the same participants?
items.a: Yes, press the 'Again' button on the result screen to spin again with the same participants.
The reel spins quickly then gradually slows to a natural stop. The result is unknown until the reel fully stops, keeping the suspense high.

steps: Press Spin to spin the reel
üé∞ The winner is revealed when the reel stops

intro.title: What is Bomb Pass?
intro.p1: Bomb Pass is an intense game where a bomb passes between participants and whoever holds it when it explodes is selected. A hidden timer means nobody knows when it will go off.
intro.p2: The bomb automatically moves clockwise and gets faster over time. Supports 2 to 20 participants.

rules.title: Detailed Rules
items: Enter participant names separated by commas or line breaks.
You can enter between 2 and 20 participants.
Press Start and the bomb automatically moves clockwise.
The bomb speeds up as time passes.
When the hidden timer ends, the bomb explodes and whoever is holding it is selected.

tips.title: When to Use
items: When you want extreme suspense
When you want to liven up a party or gathering
When you want a thrilling way to pick someone for a penalty
When you want a quick and simple way to select someone

items.a: The bomb explodes at a random time between 5 and 15 seconds. Nobody knows the exact time, maximizing the suspense.

items.q: How does the bomb speed change?
items.a: It starts slow and gradually speeds up. Near the end it moves very fast, making it hard to predict who will be holding it.
Yes, both the timer and starting position are completely random, giving everyone an equal chance.

steps: Press Start to pass the bomb
üí£ Whoever holds it when it explodes is selected!

intro.title: What is Horse Race?
intro.p1: Horse Race is a random game where participants race on horseback to determine the full ranking. Unlike other games that select one winner, every participant gets ranked from first to last.
intro.p2: Horses run at random speeds with constant overtaking and comebacks, making the result unpredictable until the very end. Supports 2 to 10 participants.

rules.title: Detailed Rules
items: Enter participant names separated by commas or line breaks.
You can enter between 2 and 10 participants.
Press Start and a countdown begins before the race.
Each horse runs at random speeds with frequent lead changes.
When all horses cross the finish line, the full ranking is revealed.

tips.title: When to Use
items: When you need a full ranking (presentation order, penalty order, etc.)
When you want to determine order from first to last all at once
When you want the excitement of watching a race
When you want to liven up a party or gathering

items.a: Yes, all horses have similar base speeds and outcomes are determined by random variation. Equal winning probability is applied to all participants.

items.q: How is this different from other games?
items.a: Other games select one person, but Horse Race ranks all participants. Great for determining presentation order, splitting teams, and more.
Yes, especially near the finish line where speed variation increases, creating last-minute comeback drama.
